confirmed_facts: Anthony Albanese (62) married Jody Hayden (46) on 29 November 2025 in Canberra.
The ceremony was private, attended by about 60 family and close friends.
Albanese and Hayden announced the marriage on 30 November 2025 via a press release and social media.
The couple will honeymoon for five days starting 1 December 2025, with all expenses paid by them.
This is the first time a sitting Australian prime minister has married while in office.
Albanese and Hayden first met in 2020 at a Melbourne dinner event and began dating in 2021.
Albanese was previously married to Carmel Tebbutt (2000â€‘2019) and has a son in his twenties.

timeline.event: Anthony Albanese and Jody Hayden marry in a private ceremony in Canberra.
Albanese announces the marriage publicly and releases a statement.
Albanese and Hayden begin a fiveâ€‘day honeymoon in Australia.
